Joan Rappoport and Steven Bruce Rosenfeld are to be married today. Rabbi Burt Aaron Siegel is to officiate at Eleven Madison Park, a restaurant in New York.
The bride, 64, will continue to use her name professionally. She is a vice president and a corporate event planner at Merrill Lynch, the New York brokerage firm. She graduated from Cornell.

She is a daughter of Shirley R. Cohen of New York and the late Zachary H. Buchalter. Her father was the president of Leslie Fay, a women's apparel manufacturer in New York. Her mother retired as a saleswoman at Ralph Cohen Designs, a sportswear manufacturer that was in New York.

The bridegroom, also 64, is a senior partner in the litigation department of Paul, Weiss, Rifkind, Wharton & Garrison, the New York law firm and is also the chairman of the New York City Conflicts of Interest Board, the agency that oversees government ethics. He graduated and received his law degree from Columbia. He is also a director of the New York Theater Workshop, an Off Broadway theater company.

He is a son of the late Laura S. Rosenfeld and the late Dr. Eugene D. Rosenfeld. The bridegroom's mother retired as a speech therapist in the speech and hearing clinic at Hunter College in New York. His father retired as the president of E. D. Rosenfeld Associates, a hospital and health services consulting firm in New York.
The bride's previous marriage ended in divorce; the bridegroom was a widower.
